title: Understanding Characteristics of ASD
text: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is characterized by two main features: persistent deficits in social communication and social interaction across multiple contexts, and restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior, interests, or activities.

title: Identifying Social Communication Deficits
text: One characteristic of ASD is a lack of interest in peers. This can manifest as difficulty in making friends or engaging in social interactions.

title: Recognizing Repetitive Behaviors
text: Repetitive behaviors in ASD can include actions like flapping of hands, rocking, or repeating certain phrases.

hintAnswer: lack of interest in peers, flapping of hands
title: Select the Correct Characteristics
text: Based on the characteristics of ASD, which of the following options correctly identifies examples of these characteristics?
choices: lack of interest in peers, flapping of hands
persistent deficits in social communication and social interaction across contexts; restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior, interests, or activities
interest in trains, persistent deficits in social communication and social interaction across contexts
educational determination, inability to handle changes in routine
